CatDescriptText: Mrs. Lena James Fuqua, housewife, Hill, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 24, 1962, pg. 8 with question: "Do you think Pittsburgh Negroes are justified in being angry at the failure of city officials to appoint a Negro as police inspector, in spite of repeated appeals to grant them representation at this level of law enforcement?" Answer reads: "Sure, but to get results, we've got to pull together."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Lena James Fuqua wearing dark coat with wide collar, and eyeglasses, standing on sidewalk, possibly Smithfield Street, in front of row of stores, Gimbles in background, Downtown
